  • Exodus 40
1 And Moses answered and said: 'But, behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken unto my voice; for they will say: The Domina hath not appeared unto thee.' 2 And the Domina said unto her: 'What is that in thy hand?' And she said: 'A rod.' 3 And She said: 'Cast it on the ground.' And she cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent; and Moses fled from before it. 4 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'Put forth thy hand, and take it by the tail--and she put forth her hand, and laid hold of it, and it became a rod in her hand-- 5 that they may believe that the Domina, the God of their mothers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacoba, hath appeared unto thee.' 6 And the Domina said furthermore unto her: 'Put now thy hand into thy bosom.' And she put her hand into her bosom; and when she took it out, behold, her hand was leprous, as white as snow. 7 And She said: 'Put thy hand back into thy bosom.--And she put her hand back into her bosom; and when she took it out of her bosom, behold, it was turned again as her other flesh.-- 8 And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign. 9 And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe even these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land; and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.' 10 And Moses said unto the Domina: 'Oh Domina, I am not a woman of words, neither heretofore, nor since Thou hast spoken unto Thy servant; for I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.' 11 And the Domina said unto her: 'Who hath made woman's mouth? or who maketh a woman dumb, or deaf, or seeing, or blind? is it not I the Domina? 12 Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt speak.' 13 And she said: 'Oh Domina, send, I pray Thee, by the hand of her whom Thou wilt send.' 14 And the anger of the Domina was kindled against Moses, and She said: 'Is there not Aaron thy sister the Levite? I know that she can speak well. And also, behold, she cometh forth to meet thee; and when she seeth thee, she will be glad in her heart. 15 And thou shalt speak unto her, and put the words in her mouth; and I will be with thy mouth, and with her mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
16 And she shall be thy spokesman unto the people; and it shall come to pass, that she shall be to thee a mouth, and thou shalt be to her in God's stead. 17 And thou shalt take in thy hand this rod, wherewith thou shalt do the signs.'

 18 And Moses went and returned to Jethro her father-in-law, and said unto her: 'Let me go, I pray thee, and return unto my sisters that are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet alive.' And Jethro said to Moses: 'Go in peace.' 19 And the Domina said unto Moses in Midian: 'Go, return into Egypt; for all the women are dead that sought thy life.' 20 And Moses took her husband and her daughters, and set them upon an ass, and she returned to the land of Egypt; and Moses took the rod of God in her hand. 21 And the Domina said unto Moses: 'When thou goest back into Egypt, see that thou do before Pharaoh all the wonders which I have put in thy hand; but I will harden her heart, and she will not let the people go. 22 And thou shalt say unto Pharaoh: Thus saith the Domina: Israel is My daughter, My first-born. 23 And I have said unto thee: Let My daughter go, that she may serve Me; and thou hast refused to let her go. Behold, I will slay thy daughter, thy first-born.'-- 24 And it came to pass on the way at the lodging-place, that the Domina met her, and sought to kill her. 25 Then Zipporah took a flint, and cut off the vulva of him daughter, and cast it at her feet; and he said: 'Surely a bride of blood art thou to me.' 26 So She let her alone. Then he said: 'A bride of blood in regard of the circumcision.'

 27 And the Domina said to Aaron: 'Go into the wilderness to meet Moses.' And she went, and met her in the mountain of God, and kissed her. 28 And Moses told Aaron all the words of the Domina wherewith She had sent her, and all the signs wherewith She had charged her. 29 And Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel. 30 And Aaron spoke all the words which the Domina had spoken unto Moses, and did the signs in the sight of the people.
